text: Hello. Got a question about the PVC size for Postgres for a validator

elements.text: Hello. Got a question about the PVC size for Postgres for a validator

text: in your helm chart, defaut size is :

elements.text: in your helm chart, defaut size is :

text: ```cluster/helm/splice-postgres/values-template.yaml:14:  volumeSize: 2800Gi```
so, 2.8TB
but on HW req page : <https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_hardware_requirements.html>
DB size ranges from 1 to 100GB
for Validator at least
so I suppose that 2.8TB is more likely for SV ?

text: Well, I did it already
issue : <https://github.com/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/issues/337>

attachments.fallback: #337 helm/validator : make PVC volume name overridable to have several validators on same cluster without having to use separate namespaces
attachments.text:
In validator helm 0.3.15, migration PVC name is hardcoded

So, to have several validators, even from distinct network in the same K8S cluster, you have to change namespace for each of them.

Better solution is to make the volume name overridable from values
attachments.title: #337 helm/validator : make PVC volume name overridable to have several validators on same cluster without having to use separate namespaces

text: and PR : <https://github.com/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/pull/338>

attachments.fallback: #338 Make it possible to overrride PVC volume name
attachments.title: #338 Make it possible to overrride PVC volume name

text: A heads up about the chart transition from `validatorWalletUser: <str>` to `validatorWalletUsers: []` that occurs somewhere between 0.3.12 and 0.3.15 - the latter is a new form that is optionally supported by the newer releases, but if you update your charts to use the list form instead, you can accidentally end up with a validator that doesn't have a wallet user mapped in when deploying one of the previous versions

elements.text: A heads up about the chart transition from

that occurs somewhere between 0.3.12 and 0.3.15 - the latter is a new form that is optionally supported by the newer releases, but if you update your charts to use the list form instead, you can accidentally end up with a validator that doesn't have a wallet user mapped in when deploying one of the previous versions

text: the newer charts have checks to make sure you set only one or the other, but the older charts can have `validatorWalletUser` be unset and proceed happily

elements.text: the newer charts have checks to make sure you set only one or the other, but the older charts can have

text: it is a non-obvious issue, in case anyone else runs into it

elements.text: it is a non-obvious issue, in case anyone else runs into it

text: Thanks!
for sure, it seems like an oversight in the releases prior to 0.3.15, and is easily fixed once you know the issue. just wanted to flag for other operators

elements.text: for sure, it seems like an oversight in the releases prior to 0.3.15, and is easily fixed once you know the issue. just wanted to flag for other operators
